result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary L. Bucholtz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine + costs + Domestic and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. 
No contact with Vincent Bucholtz, unless Vincent and Agent consents.   
Early Discharge, if recomended by Agent. 
No restitution requested.

Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary L. Bucholtz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Gary L. Bucholtz in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:54 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is before the Court on a sentencing after revocation.

Court did receive a revocation packet.
State received their copy of the packet.
State has no corrections to make.
Atty Halverson received a copy of the packet.
Atty Halverson addresses the Court regarding clarifications.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
There are no victims.

State joins in the recommendation of the department. Jail sentence with days credit, making it a time served sentence.

Atty Halverson addresses the Court, concurs with recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 9 Months
203 Days Jail Credit
Time served sentence

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 9 Months
Concurrent to Count 2
203 Days Jail Credit
Time served sentence

Count 4:
Jail sentence of 30 Days
Consecutive to Count 2 and Count 3
26 Days credit
Time served sentence

Court will order a civil judgment for all the unpaid court costs, totaling $1,669 for all 3 counts
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-09-2016 03:30 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 04-01-2016 10:30 am

9:04 a.m. Defendant Gary L. Bucholtz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Cts 2, 3, & 4: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent:   Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. Maintain full-time employment.   Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. No contact with Vincent Bucholtz. Pay $500 fine on one of the counts and the other two pay costs. Early Discharge, if recomended by Agent. No restitution requested. Jail credit of 185 days, if revoked.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Ct 1 to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Cts 2, 3, & 4 - No Contest on each.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Cts 2, 3, & 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Ct 1 is Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint recommendation.  

BY THE COURT:***Probation****
Count 2: Intentionally Point Firearm At Person: 
W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with each other.  
Conditions:
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 
Maintain full-time employment.   
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. 
No contact with Vincent Bucholtz, unless Vincent and Agent consents. 
Pay $500 fine + Pay $100 Domestic surcharge and DNA surcharge.  
Early Discharge, if recomended by Agent. 
No restitution requested. 
Jail credit of 185 days, if revoked.

 
Count 3: Battery: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with each other. Pay costs. Same conditions as count 2.

Count 4: Disorderly Conduct: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with each other. Pay costs. Same conditions as count 2.
Plea hearing at 09-09-2015 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 07-20-2015 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 06-08-2015 10:00 am

5/8/15 Bond is amended from $2,500 cash bond to $5,000 signature bond with the same conditions: 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.  No contact with Vincent Bucholtz or his family or their residences.

Defendant Gary L. Bucholtz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Gary L. Bucholtz in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Drengler does not agree with the agreement as stated. 

10:37 a.m.  Court takes a brief recess to allow for the parties to discuss the matter. 
10:47 a.m.  Court is back in session.  The appearances remain the same. 

Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court.  There is a material difference in what the plea agreement is.  Defense is requesting this be set for an additional pre-trial conference. 
Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler indicates the defendant is to be released from prison on 6/8/15.  Atty Drengler requests the bond be reduced to allow the defendant to possibly post it. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant will be released to extended supervision. 
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court.  Will leave the decision to the court. 

BY THE COURT:  For the reasons stated on the record, the court will amend the cash bond to a $5,000 signature bond with the same conditions.  Defendant is not required to appear at the pre-trial on 6/8 but is to keep in contact with his attorney. 

Court returns the plea/questionnaire to Atty Drengler. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus
